title: Serif to work with Flama
content:
Any suggestions on a serif that could paired with [Flama](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312150123/http:/www.felicianotypefoundry.com/main/?page_id=10)?

This is for a corporate identity program for a hospitality group that runs a chain of luxury business hotels. The serif would typically be used for body text in applications like their in-house magazine, menus etc.

Thanks very much in advance for any help!
author: writingdesigning

comments.content: Did you take a look at the serif typefaces that are on Feliciano's site itself?

I did, but I wanted something slightly taller. Eventually we seem to have decided on DTL Paradox (if I can manage to figure out how to get things done on that quirky DTL online shop). Do you think that makes sense?
Well, as it turned out the client baulked at the price. So any suggestion is still welcome for a high 'x' height font that's slightly on the expressive side.

You might have seen the topic about [Fonts for bookdesign](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312150123/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39592) already, but there are alot of good suggestions in it. I know it says bookdesign, but most of the fonts listed obviously work for magazines as well. :)
Thank you. I will take a look.
